Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:The sanctions against the school were a punishing blow, and they seemed to what the efforts the school had made to change? Choices:  A: ignore B: enforce C: authoritarian D: yell at E: avoid<n><n>### Response:		 C<n><n>### <n>

Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n><n>### Response:		<n>**(1)** The Netherlands would be one of the places with a lot of canals because the Dutch canal network contains over one thousand named canals, in total 3200 kilometres (2000 mi), and almost 6000 kilometres (4000 mi) for waterways in general.<n><n><n>**(2)** To get an idea of how long the route is for travelers, imagine standing at the starting dock and looking up at the towers of Amsterdam’s Central Station. As the waterway unfolds towards your left, you will see a canal ring that is actually made up of four semi-circles.<n><n><n>** (3)** The ring is about 300 metres (1000 ft) wide. The canal ring connects all of central Amsterdam. The waterways within the ring of the city have a total length of 60 kilometres (37 miles). It is now estimated that 165 kilometers (105 miles) of Amsterdam’s waterway system are still navigable. There are numerous bridges over these waterways.<n><n><n>**  (4)** Amsterdam has more than 1200 bridges. More than 800 years ago in the 9th century, in the middle of the 19th century, a canal was dug in the center of Amsterdam. On the edges of the city, small dikes were built to prevent the canal from spilling into the city's streets. For centuries, Amsterdam was protected by these dikes.<n><n><n>**   (5)** One day about 1635, a canal builder named Cornelius van der Schuyt put an idea to the city's rulers. He proposed a radical solution: he said the city should dig an enormous canal that would surround the whole city. This canal would have more than half a million square meters of land. It would also be 15 kilometers long. The city was going to use this canal instead of the city's dikes to defend itself.<n><n><n>**     (6)** Van der Schuyt's plan was accepted. In 1638, van der Schuyt and the city started to build Amsterdam's famous canal ring.<n><n><n>**      (7)** They started by digging a wide canal next to what is now Hereng

Choices:  A: gathering of information B: communication C: feel relaxed D: kill boredom E: social bonding<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The person is chatting with friends is likely hoping to accomplish:<n><n>(1) Gathering of information : The gathering of information helps him to get the latest news and update so he can have more knowledge and better decision making from his past knowledge. <n><n>(2) Communication : The communication skills are used for interacting and connecting between the people and also used as a means of communication between people.  It is the base of human interaction and helps people to understand each other and express their feelings and emotions. And they can do the best thing by using his/her communication skills.<n><n>(3) Feel relaxed : Communicating with friends help him/her to relax his/her mind.  He/she should share his/her feelings and emotions to his/her friends. It will be easy for him/her to cope with the problem which comes with stress.<n><n>(4) Kill boredom : Communicating with friends is the best and easiest way to kill boredom.  Boredom can attack you anytime and make you feel unhappy. It is a state of mind which creates a feeling of dissatisfaction and unhappiness in many different situations.<n><n>So it is good to have a good friend whom he can share his feelings and emotions.  Friendship helps us connect with the outer word.  It creates a safe zone so we can share good experiences, ideas, and feelings with other people and make our life better.<n><n>(5) Social bonding : Friendship is one of the best social skills and most importantly.  Friends with a nice personality develops good habits that help in building a bright future.  It helps in boosting the confidence and self-esteem.  It makes him feel confident and gives himself the strength to face any tough situation.  We become mature and emotionally strong by sharing our troubles and feelings with our friends.  Good and real friends always have mutual understanding and always stand by our side at difficult times.  They inspire positive thoughts and do not let the negativity affect their mind-set.  Friends make us feel free and stress-free for having a friend.  They become a support after which we find ourselves much happier.  Friends are there to share happiness as well as sadness, so they are an easy form of emotional therapy.  They are so supportive to make us

Choices:  A: desk drawer B: desktop C: office D: wristwatch E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>* Complete the following task using only the information given in the instructions.<n>* Don't alter or change the input provided.<n>* The output should be displayed in its terminal window.<n><n>### Input to be copied and pasted:<n><n>* The car-rental company charges $30/a day for a rental, or they charge $190 for car rental for the duration of one week for any rental lasting more than a week. Jenny rented a car for ten days. How much, dollars, did Jenny paid for renting this car?<n><n>### Output to be displayed:<n><n>The output should be displayed to the terminal window.<n><n>* The total cost Jenny paid is $310(40 bucks for each day)<n><n>* Demonstration: The above example is a demonstration of my program as requested by you in the second line of description<n><n>* The input has been provided in the above description section of the task.  The output has been provided above at the very bottom line<n><n># Output for the Demonstration<n><n>### Demostration:<n>* The above example is a demon station of how this program works<n><n>### Input for the Demostration<n><n>* $30 a day for a rental for Jenny rented a rental for ten days.<n><n>### Output for the Demostratiion<n><n>```<n>$30 a day for everyday x10days =10/10 days x30 dollars =$310<n>```<n><n>### Demotarative Output<n><n>### Description of Program<n><n>#### Description of Functions<n><n>* The above program was written with a single function in order to show how the program has been written.<n><n>### The Code<n>```<n>#include <iostream><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main() {<n>    int tenDays;<n>    cout << "Enter the days you will need the car" << endl;<n>    cin >> tenDays<n>    cout << "how much is renting a car per day =$30" << endl;<n><n>    int answer = tenDays * $30;<n><n>    cout << "Your total cost for renting the car is " << answer << endl;<n><n>return 0;<n>

Choices:  A: suicide B: overdosing C: sadness D: murder E: cyanide<n><n>### Response:		A) Suicide<n><n>### Explain:<n>- Suicide.<n><n>### Output:The number of days it took a farmer to repair his tractor was 17. He finished the repair after the 7th day.  How much antifreeze, in gallons, was leftover?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Explain how to complete the task requested (by either using an image or an explanation).<n><n>### Example:<n>For the input question, "What leads to someone's deaht when they are very depresssed?", the answer would be a choice of A. Suicide.<n>For the follow-up question, the answer "Suicide" means the choice "A".<n>The following questions are designed to check that you understood and completed the task correctly.<n><n>The output question asks for the number of gallons of antifreeze left after performing a repair job using half of the initial 30-gallon container.<n>So the antifreeze used to perform the task = 30/2 = 15<n>Then the antifreeze left over = 30-15 = 15<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where is a tabby cat likely to be happiest? Choices:  A: box B: home C: alley D: lap E: barn<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question and support your answer with reasons. Provide a detailed response.<n><n>### Response<n>Input: A: box B:home C: alley D:= lap E:barn<n><n>Input:  Answer and support the answer with reasons<n><n>Input: Where is a tabby cat  likely to be happiest   Answer: <n>A: box B:  home C:   alley D: = lap E: barn   Supporting answer 1: home. The tabby cat is home-loving and enjoys a peaceful home over box and other alley  2: barn.  barn environment is peaceful  3= lap.  lap is one place that every tabby cat loves<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:What is a person who is well educated? Choices:  A: illiterate B: knowledgable C: own house D: have enough food E: meet expectations<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. How many months did you work?<n>2. It took 4 months to prepare.<n>3. We can complete the work in 2 months.<n><n>### Input A:We cannot afford to buy a house. Choices: <n>A: ill-founded B: over-priced C: impossible D: outdated E: low income<n><n>### Response A:We cannot afford it.<n><n>### The following set of questions are multi-step. Complete each step below.<n>1. How long will the job take you to complete? (8 hours for each set, 8 x 16)<n>2. How much will it cost you to complete the job? (16 Hours x $50 dollars per hour = $800)<n>3. Do you think you are prepared to complete the job?<n>4. Is the job worth more than what you will be paid for doing it?<n>5. What will you do when you find out that the job is more physically difficult than what you expected?<n><n>### Instructions:Complete this multi-step task to obtain additional practice.<n><n>1. Estimate how long the job will take.<n> <n>2. Estimate what it would cost you in time and materials to complete the job.<n> <n>3. Consider if the job is worth what you will need to invest to get it done.<n> <n>4. Consider if this is a job you want at this price.<n><n>### What will the work on the assignment bring to your life?<n><n>### Do you want to do this work on your own?<n><n>### Why is the work on the assignment useful to you?<n><n>### What are your interests and goals?<n><n>### Have you had time to think about this assignment and what it means to you?<n><n><n><n>---<n>© 2020 Trilogy Education Services, LLC, a 2U, Inc. brand. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input1:The number 54 is an even number.  12 is a square.  A rectangle is a quadrilateral with: 1.  four flat sides; 2.  four right angles; and  3.  two pairs of parallel opposite sides.  If a rectangle is composed of a right triangle of unit length and an isosceles trapezoid, then the area of the rectangle is: 1.  infinite; 2.  5.4 units; 3.  4 units; or 4.  1.5 units.  Answer: 4<n><n><n>### Input2: The answer to 5 times 6 is 30.  Twice 9 is 18.  6 times 2 is 12.  18 goes into 30 five times.  9 goes into 12 three times.  12 goes into 15 zero times.  How many times does 12 go into 30?<n><n>### Response2:<n>A<n><n><n># 1.  If the carnival's midway rides and attractions cost $500 and the rest of the fair's concessions cost $100, then what percent of the money the fair charged for admission went for the rest of the fair?  Answer: (((((Number of concessions)/(Cost of carnival attractions and concessions)))))/100<n><n><n>#2.   What percent of the money the carnival charged for admission went to the cost of admission?  Answer: (0.01/((((number of concessions)/cost of carnival attracations and concessions))/100)<n><n>#3. Which operation is done in the above equation?  *(number of concession}/cost of carnival attcations and concesssions)/100<n><n>#4. How many rides and attractions could the carnival offer for the same money the fair used to host its carnival?  ((((Number of attractions)/(cost of carnivalattracions and concessions))))<n><n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following number operations multiple choice questions.<n><n>-*If the answers need clarification
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:The president had to make a decision regarding the hate attack on his country, what did he do? Choices:  A: wage war B: fight enemy C: kill D: destroy enemy E: attacked his country<n><n>### Response:		The president had to make a  decision regarding the hate attack  on his country.  He  chose  **C:  kill enemy.**<n><n>### Why?<n>We selected the sentence: "The  president  had  to make  a  decision  regarding  the hate attack on his  country,  what  did he do?"<n>The verb in the previous sentence must agree in number with the subject which is a singular noun, _country._<n>Hence, the proper answers are 5 to 7.<n><n>We selected the sentence which has: _choices:  A:  wage war B:  fight  enemy C:  kill D:  destroy enemy E:  attacked his country._<n>We found it as **C:  kill  enemy.** because it is the only sentence which is correct.<n><n>### Why?:<n><n>We selected the first sentence which has choice: _A: wage war._ Then, we selected the second sentence which has choice:  _B:  fight enemy._ Since, the two sentences are not correct; then, the correct choices are 5, 6, 7.<n><n>### Explanation<n>The correct choices are:<n><n>| Number Choices          | Reason                                                                                                          |<n>| ----------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |<n>| 0                        | It doesn't make sense.                                                                               |<n>| 1                        | The verb in the previous sentence is _what_. It needs 2 options.                                 |<n>| 2                        | The verb must agree in number with  the subject which is a  singular noun _country._  We can find  1 option.                                            |<n>| 3                        | 3 choices are already given _country; 5000 dollars 50 percent_; we can find 2   right choices and 1   wrong choice _choose_. Only the 5th   choice is correct. |<n>| 4                        | We can't find the choice we seek from 4 choices.                                    |<n><n>

The total acres is divided among sheep according to the same formula as all of the sheep. How much money does the woman keep when she divided the money according to each group?<n><n>### Answer:136.25

The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where would someone learn to play an upright piano? Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demystification:  Explain why your response is correct.<n><n>### Above instruction:How we can write the solution.<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration:  Input:A train moves through a tunnel at 60 miles and hour, and stops at a station.The distance between the station and the tunnel mouth is 8 miles long. How long does it take for the train to come to a stop from when it leaves the tunnel?  Answer:10<n><n>## Demystification:  Write a short program that implements the logic of this demonstration. The input and output should be specified below.<n><n>## Demysticifation<n><n>### Input<n><n>- How long does it take the train to come to stop from the the tunnel<n>- input : 10,40<n><n>### Output:<n><n>- The same answer<n>- 10<n><n>### Instrictions<n><n>- Use this code:<n><n>### Code:<n><n>train = '10'<n>distance = '40'<n><n>while train!= distance:<n>        print('distance:',train)<n>        train = input('Enter a second:')<n>        if train < distance:<n>                print('you have stop the train in 10 secs!')<n>        if train > distance:<n>                break<n>        else:<n>                distance =  input('Enter a second')<n>        if train == distance:<n>                print 'you have stop the train successully in 10 seceond'<n><n>### Output<n><n>- How long, in seconds, does it take the train, on average, to come to a stop?<n>- Enter a second: 10<n>- average: 10 0<n><n><n>### Avoiding Problems<n><n>- Code for problematic situations.<n><n>### Testing Code<n><n>### References<n><n>### Sources:

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where would you be able to hear a bassoon played in an unpleasing fashion? Choices:  A: orchestra B: baritone woodwind sound C: symphony D: play music E: high school band<n><n>### Response:		<n>### In the baritone woodwind family, what is the lowest pitched instrument? <n>    Answer: Bassoon<n>### What does a bassoon sound like?<n>### In a orchestra, would you hear a Bassoon instrument?<n>### Do you prefer to hear a piano, or a bassoon?<n><n>### Discussion:  <n>A, D, A + D; The answer is A, orchestra. The Bassoon has a very deep sound, that’s not particularly pleasant to listen to. <n>The sound also travels long distances.<n><n>

This section has been assigned as a task. It's your job to describe a task as clearly and concisely as possible. Here, you are writing a response to a question to help make someone's job easier.<n><n>Before completing this task, take a careful reading of the assignment. You will have one task to complete, but may be provided with additional instructions that help you complete your task. Your task will be displayed on your screen. It will look something like this:<n><n>#### Task 1:<n><n>Write a response in the text box. Your response should answer the question. You may also print the manual for the entire Help course.<n><n>### What You Need to Know<n>This is a task. It is your job to perform this task. You will be given a task, and your only job is to perform that task. This is the task:<n><n>### Task:<n><n>Write a description of a task.<n><n>You are the task writer. Your task is to write a description of a task you need someone to perform.<n><n>As you read in the Task Instructions above, the task instructions should tell you:<n><n> - Who should perform the task<n> - What the task is<n> - Where and when the task is to be performed<n> - How the task is to be done<n> - When it should be performed<n><n>### Constraints<n><n>If you have any constraints (limitations or restrictions, such as who should perform this task, where and when, etc.) on a task write your limitations into the text box as instructions. Constraints should not be mixed with task instructions (like the instructions for the task above). You should type your constraint directly in the text box in a different style font (not "italics" (like we did it above for the task instructions). This makes it easy to recognize. Any constraint should be placed here, so it will be treated as instructions by the tool.<n><n>### If you are unsure how to

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where can peanut butter be stored? Choices:  A: container B: supermarket C: pantry D: sandwich E: jar<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Jackson is a popular city name, but the one with a governor's office is where? Choices:  A: michigan B: wyoming C: mississippi D: tennessee E: mississippi<n><n>### Response:		The answer is option A<n><n>### Instructions:Rewrite the following sentences so that it agrees with the singular form of the pronoun.<n><n>### Input sentence:I know that you are going to do well on the math test.<n>### Output:I know you are going to do<n><n>Input sentence:  A person with the last name of Johnson is living in this city. How many people with the last name of Johnston lives here?<n><n>Output: I don't know.<n><n>### Output: I know he will do.<n><n>Input sentence: The house in the video is my uncle's house.<n><n>Output: The house in the movie is my uncle's.<n><n>### Response to Input: The video in the response below shows how to complete the input.<n><n>### There are 2 types of pronoun agreement:<n>### * Subject Verb agreement<n>### * Object Pronoun Agreeement<n><n>### Subject Verb agreement<n>When determining the agreement of a pronoun with a subject or main part of the sentence, it must agree in number. For example "you" is plural, so it must take a verb in the plural form. So you can't write "I know you did" (plural verb, with a singular pronoun) because "you" is plual.<n><n>### Object pronoun agreement<n>When determing the agreement of a pronoum with an object, it must agree in person and in number. For example, "You are going to a good concert" will not change "concert" to "concerts", but it will need to have the pronoun "you" and the noun "concert" change in agrement with the subject "concert" which is plural.<n><n>### Example 1<n>"The boy jumped out onto the ledge. He was very confident that he could make a perfect jump."<n><n>### How would you change it? (the answer below shows how to reword the sentence in agreement)<n><n>"The boy jump out onto the ledge he was very confident that he was able to make the perfect jump."<n><n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Choices:  A: cash drawer B: piggy bank C: purse D: box E: pocket<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Please identify the type of data that can be converted from words into numbers.<n><n># Examples<n><n>Here are some examples of how to convert data into numbers. Please understand that in the real world, you can only convert things into numbers which can be categorized as such but are not:<n><n>1. 1800 (telephone number)<n><n>2. 0800 (tele-sales customer service number)<n><n>3. 9500 (fax number)<n><n>4.  4200 (address/zipcode) (not exactly 'numbers' but can be converted into numbers when necessary e.g. in banking)<n><n># Tips<n><n>You must know the format in which you can convert data into numbers, then you must also have to know the format in which these numbers are stored. The following questions will allow you an opportunity to learn ways to convert numbers to text:<n><n>1. Write a program to convert an inputted integer between 0 and 9 in string form into its equivalent numerical value.<n><n>2. Write a program to reverse the words 'hello world'<n><n>3. Write a program to find the last character of a series of words.<n><n>4. Write a program to output the words you cannot convert to numbers.<n><n># Solution<n>## Challenge 2.01 <n>Convert an inputted integer between the numbers 0 and 9 into its equivalent numerical value 0 through 9. This task is very straight forward, it converts the value of 8 into the string value of "eight".<n>The code is provided. The user inputted a value between 0 and 3. Then the value is converted to a string. Then the string is converted back to an integer number. Then the inputted value is outputted.<n>You can follow the program in this tutorial or simply copy/paste the code below.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>"""<n>Written by: Lilian<n>Rolando T. Barsoto<n><n>Solution for: 2.01<n><n>"""<n><n># Input values into a variable.<n>myNum = int (input("Please enter a number between 0 and 2: "))<n><n># Convert myNum into a string<n>myNum = myNum.strip() # Strip whitespaces<n>

A flight is defined to last for two hours if the plane is traveling at 500 mph and one hour if traveling at 600 mph. The plane is currently averaging 550 mph flying from New York to Chicago. How far away from Chicago is the plane's average altitude?<n><n>### Response A:<n>The answer to this problem is 382.11 miles. From New York the plane averages 550 m.p.h. and Chicago is 1,060 miles away from new York. So 550 m/h is equal or divided by 1060 is 0.52274<n><n><n>### Input B:Daily news reports indicate that the average price for a house in the United States is $194,000. To this you multiply half of the 200 houses together it would be 100 then you multiple.69 by 100 it would be 69.<n><n><n>### Instructions: Choose the best answer choice. <n><n>### Input C:The time-value of money states that money is worth more now than at some point in the future. Sam realized then that the cow must be a cowboy, and he said, "How do you ride the horse, cowboy?" The cow explained, "I get ready to ride, and I tie the top of the triangle to the horse.  Then I hold the bottom of the triangle to catch the other cows."<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Sam rode to the park and met a cow. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:The garage had light sensors and automatic doors, what kind of house was it? Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n><n>### Response:		A modern house<n><n>### Instructions:Answer each question.<n><n>## Problem:<n><n>### Instuction: The car-rentals agency charges 45 dollars and a dollar an extra for each added day. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: 3 days.<n><n>Solution: 60 dollars.<n><n>Input: 5 days.<n><n>Solotion: 51 dollars<n><n>Input: 2 days.<n><n>Soloution: 65 dollars<n><n>Input:1 days<n>Soloution:46 dollars<n> <n>## Answer: <n>

Choices:  A: bookstore B: library C: doctor D: home E: table<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer the magazines are at home. To correctly answer the question you need to look for any clues that will help you to choose the right answer.<n><n>- The question asks where most where people keep the magazines so you need to pick the option that has the biggest number.<n>- There are 5 options for home, bookshop, library, doctor's office and a table.<n>- To complete the question you need to add up how many each of the words has been given and where it is being used to work out the answer.<n><n>### Input 2<n><n>Input: A train leaves Omaha on December 2nd heading east and arrives in Lincoln on December 4th. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:James didn't know what to do.  He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		<n>James didn't know that he should go further. At the same time, James thought that by pushing farther something good might be produced.<n><n>### Input Answer(s):<n>A) 1; B)2<n><n>### Demo Answer(s):<n><n>Input:The number of houses, cottages, shacks, etc., standing or not, at Lake Tahoe at any given time is approximately equal to the number of tourists (people visiting the lake). At the lake, we can estimate the number of visitors according to the 2 following rules:<n><n>* 10% of visitors stay or rent a room or cottage for more than 6 days,<n><n>so the number of tourists per day is approximately equal to the sum of the number of days for which a room or cottge is occupied from time to time.<n><n>* 30% of visitors rent a room or cuttage for 2-6 days,<n><n>and about 65% of visitors  stay at a motel or hotel for 1-2 days or less.<n><n>In other words:<n><n>* A motel-guests counts as 0.5 persons visiting the lake for 1-2 day<n><n>and<n><n>* A cottage-occupier counts as 5 persons visiting thelake for 6 day<n><n>Because people are not always at the lake on the days for which they have booked<n>a hotel room, and there are days when no visitors come  at all, we have to consider 2 groups of vacationers<n><n>* Day visitors: persons staying at a hotel with one night included. We use 2 persons per room and 10 rooms per each day as a rough estimate of the number of Day visitors. So the number of day vistors is 3 × 2 × 10 = 60 people per day.<n><n>* Weekly vacationers: persons staying more than 3 nights. We use 5 persons per cottage and 24 cottages per each day as a  rough estimate of the number day visitors. So the number day vistors is:5x24=120 persons per day.<n><n>The number of motel guests and cottage guests is the sum of day-visitors:<n><n>60 + 120 =

Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n><n>### Response:		The word vegetarian can be a noun or an adjective.  In this context, we need vegetarians to behave in a particular way.  Since “more” is a comparison between two quantities or situations, we can’t see how the vegetarians are gaining wealth.  It’s certainly not happening in large numbers.  So, the only answer choice that fits is the one about eating plants.<n>

A teakettle typically used over an open fire or on a hob. The word teakettle is almost always limited to portable kettles. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n># Importing libraries<n>print 'Welcome to the fishing supply store! What type of fishing rod would you like today?<n>print 'A: furniture store, B: fishing camp, C: hardware store, D: sporting goods, E: engine'<n>fishingChoice = input()<n><n>print 'Fishing rods start at the price of $10'.<n><n>if fishingChoice == 'A':<n>	print 'We will have to transfer you to the furniture store!'<n>else:<n>	if fishingChoice =='C':<n>		print 'Ok! How big would you like the rod?  (We keep all bass rods on hand)'<n>	elif fishingChoice =='D':<n>		print '#'<n>		print '# Our sporting goods section offers tackle but we may have too much. We  offer all brands and can get you the best fishing rod'<n>	elif fishingCoumse == 'E':<n>		print ''<n>		print '# This is where we do our deep-sea fishing. We love big fish around here and will help you hook one of these monsters.'<n>	else:<n>		print 'Sorry, that is an incorrect entry. Please retry.'<n>		print 'If you have any questions do not hesitate to ask us'<n>```<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where would one find a captive monkey? Choices:  A: rain forest B: tree tops C: toy store D: zoological gardens E: great outdoors<n><n>### Response:		A: Captive monkeys can only be found in the rain forests, and great outdoors.<n><n>### Input :  What is the most common species of cat? Choices:  a) Maine Coon b) Persian c) Burmese d) Abyssinian e) Domestic<n><n>### Response : A: The Maine Coon is by far the most common species of pet cat found in the United States.<n><n>### Question:What are some of the most common types of dog? Choices: 1) pit bull 2) chow 3) Rottweiler 4) shepherd 5) German shepherd <n><n>### Response 1: A group of dogs that are common are the German shepherd and the Rottweiler.<n><n>### Response2: 1. The two most common American dog breeds are the Rottweiler and German Sheppard.<n><n>### Task:   In which decade did the television show “The Cosby Show” air? Choices: a) 1960s b) 1970s c) 1980s d) 1990s e) 2000s<n><n>### Task 2: What are some of the most popular TV shows? Anthonisen, stand from 1978 until 2009? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Where would a human expect to find manufacturing operations? Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.<n><n>### Validation:<n><n>If answer is correct, 0.<n><n>If answer is incorrect, 2.<n><n>### Testing:<n>To check for valid entries in the answer: <n><n>##### Test 1<n>Check whether answer is a multiple of 10. <n><n>To test for valid answers, the computer should first divide the number by 10. If the answer is not a multiple of 11 (such as 7, 13, or 17), 0 is returned.   If it is multiple of 10 (like 10, 20, 30), a random value in the range of 0-19 is generated and the sum of these values is returned. <n><n>##### 1. Do not call Tests.<n><n>##### 2. Call test function once, then return result.<n><n>##### Tests: <n><n>1.  Test 1: Check whether answer is multiple of 11.<n><n>    When the number is 11 or is not a multiple of that number (such as 7). If it is then 0 is returned. If it does not the sum of the values 0, 1, 2, … , 18, 19 are generated and sum them and return that random value.<n><n>2.  Test 2: Check sum of number to determine whether it is valid<n><n>    Returns the value of the sum of the two sets of numbers and check if it is a perfect square and not less than zero (since that will not be in the list of possible answers).<n><n>#### Summary<n><n>If the sum is valid return 0.<n><n>Else return the random value.<n>

What did he shoot at? Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> In the instructions, there is a multiple choice question and a demonstration. The car rental company charges $30 dollars per day, $190 per week, and $10 per additional day. The first section of the question states a person rented a car for eleven days. If the multiple choice question and demonstration were the only instructions, the best answer to the question is A. <n><n>> The next section states the travel time for the road trip. If someone used a car rental for a week, then the answer for the week would be 164 hours.  This would allow at least 164 hours to complete the road trip. If the next section stated that the car rental was to be transported from Austin to Houston, the total driving time would be 72 hours. If the car is traveling at top speed, then the travel time for 60 miles would take two hours. <n><n>> With a little more research, one would notice that the total driving time was more accurate than using the car rental for the week since the car rental companies will still have the car from Sunday to Monday. If the answer provided was one option, the best answer is D, because the question was unclear on the total hours the car rental would be provided for. <n><n>> If the next section had read, “Jason works on a poulty farm and needs to drive twice per month to buy supplies. The farm is 60 miles away and Jason’s truck can travel 225 miles per day at 24 miles per hour”, then the correct answer would be C.<n><n>> The next problem was a bit confusing because it stated the total number of children in Melissa’s family, but it also gave the answer for their income. If there were 180 children and their income was $3900, then the total would still be $180. However, the income given was more than the total children. With a little math, one could determine that each child had $21 and there was $1040 left over.<n><n>> In the last question, one could figure out that the ambulance ride was costing the family a little more than the cost of the medication, so therefore $1800 is the cost for the ambulance.<n><n>#### Explanation and solution:<n><n>1

Choices:  A: have tv B: fall asleep C: learn D: sitting E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		B. Fall asleep<n><n>### Reason: The activities that you are referring to might make a person sit but does not help them to learn.<n>Thus, the choice that is correct is B.<n><n>### Input_3:How many times does a man with a 500-mile commute drive over the same stretch of roadway each day? Give your answer in millions. <n><n>### Response_3:The answer is: 1950<n><n>### Reasons: A man traveling 500 miles each day will travel the same distance (4.6 miles) 1950 times during the year.<n>Thus, he will pass the same stretch of road (assuming a flat earth) 195o times.<n><n>Thus, the answer is 1950.<n><n>### A<n><n>```py<n>#!/usr/bin/env python3<n><n>```<n>import re<n><n><n>def find_all_substrings(s, n):<n>    ans = {}<n><n>    n = int(n)<n><n>    def find_first(s1, s2):<n>        # Return the first index of s1 in s2<n>        start = s2.find(s1)<n><n>        return start or len(s2)<n><n>    # If s == '', then we are looking for an empty string and<n>    # start should be the start index of the string<n>    def is_empty(s):<n>        # An empty string is equal to an empty string<n>        return s == ''<n><n>    def is_prefix(s):<n>        if 1 <= len(s) <= n:<n>            return True<n>        return False<n><n>    def issuffix(s):<n>        return True if s == '' else False<n><n>    def substring_length(s, n): return n == 0<n><n>    def substring(s, prefix):<n>        if issubclass(type(prefix), str):<n>            prefix = prefix[0]<n><n>        def is_prefix(prefix, s):<n>            return is_empty(s)<n><n>        return find_first(prefix, s)<n><n>    def generate_next(sub_len):<n>        # We are working on finding substring that are at least<n>        # of length >= sub_len.<n>

Choices:  A: race track B: kentucky derby C: american southwest D: triple crown E: horse derby<n><n>### Response:		Answer (a)<n><n>### Input The most common way of dividing numbers is into even and odd numbers. To know if a number is even or odd, you can use a property of numbers known as divisibility. One way to test for divisibility is to look at the last digit in the original number. 12 is divisible by 3 because 12 divided by 3 equals 4 remainder 0. Divisibility for any number can be tested by asking, is the last digit a multiple of the divisor? If the last digit in 12 is a multiple of three than twelve will be divisible by three.  You do not have to divide 12 into three smaller numbers. If it is divisible by three, then the remainder will be zero. So 12 is divisble by three, and the divisor would be 3 because the last digit is a multiple of three. Divisibility also applies to the concept of a number square. 3 is another example of divisibility because when you square a number such as 3, the answer 9 gives an equation 3 x 9 equals 21. 1 to the power of any number will always be divisible because you can write any number out equal to 1 when you add one to the exponent. 3 x 9 = 27 and 1 to the power 27 is 1 which will be divisible by any number.<n><n>### Response (b-c)

Each year the symphony makes $100,000 from ticket sales.  Each year there is at least a 10 percent increase in the cost of the program.  What is the cost of the program in 20 years?<n><n>### Processing<n>Input:The cost of the program, after a 10 percent price increase in 20 years is $75.<n><n>### Response <n><n>*The car rental company has four cars, five vans, and 14 trucks. In a 12 hour day, what is the total number of vehicles with gasoline tanks available? Choices: A: 17 B: 35 C:26 D:51 E:14<n><n>### Rules for the Car Rental Business:<n>*A vehicle has 190 gallons of gasoline in its tank.<n>*4 cars can fill a tank.<n>*A tank takes 2 hours to fill.<n>* 5 vans hold a total of 565 gallons.<n>* A van takes 250 gallons.<n>*A truck holds 120 gallons.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>*4 Vans and 5 Trucks will have Gasoline tanks<n><n>Input:  One in a hundred people uses the public library every day. Write a program to determine whether or not the integer is a multiple of seven.<n>##Input B: The program should use only the following instructions:<n><n>### GOSUB<n>### RETURN<n>### LOOP<n>### PRINT<n>### INPUT<n>### END<n>### Response<n><n>### 15007 is a multiple of 7<n><n>### Input B:The program should only use the following instructions:<n>### GOSIB<n>### GOSU<n>

Over the course of a year, this car would typically drive a total of 6,300 kms.  Since the Mustang uses no gasoline, the only cost associated with its operation is that of electricity to recharge the battery and an annual inspection, which costs $____ per year.  The city of Austin buys electricity at a rate of $0.052097/kWh, and the state has an EV rebate program that provides a rebate of $2000 to those who have fully electric vehicles.  To get the total cost of owning the electric vehicle, multiply the mileage driven by the cost of a single charging and multiply it by the annual inspection fee.  Subtract the rebate from the sum.  This is the cost.<n><n>### Input :  <n>The town you live in has a population of 72,630 people, and the city has decided to expand its town limits to a radius of 12 miles. You have to understand that requests may be declined based upon the circumstances, and those circumstances may not be related to the request itself. Also, there may be circumstances that cause the subject to accept the request and there are also circumstances that cause the subject not to accept a request. You must know the circumstances that cause you to decline a request or accept a request so that you can understand the circumstances that caused you to make the request. You should have your information about the circumstances that cause a subject to decline a request, but not about the request. You may not want your subject to know this. After you learn the information about the request, you can ask your subject about the circumstances that caused the subject to decline a previous request. You may ask your subject to explain the circumstances that caused you not to accept the request. Once you learn the circumstances, you should write down the information.<n><n>### Input:-Why did you decline the request to donate?<n><n>###Response: "I don't want to give because I find your request to be offensive to my sense of right and wrong."<n>###<n><n><n>### Input-Amy asks: Have I ever done something to upset you?<n>###<n>### Response-"No."<n>###<n><n>

Choices:  A: manipulate B: charming C: deceive D: exaggerate E: incompetent<n><n>### Response:		The agent said she was manipulative but it is the opposite of honest and can lead to confusion and misunderstanding.<n><n>### Input<n>We have asked to build a new home on an existing foundation, which can save 10%, how much will that mean in real dollars to you?<n><n>### Answer: it will save us 780$.<n>-Input: The amount that they are saving by using an existing foundation<n><n>-Input: The percentage which is 10%<n><n>-Answer: $5,000 is 10% of $50,000<n><n>-Answer:.01 x $5,00<n>-Answer:.9 x 5000<n><n>## Task<n>Given an integer X which is the width of the street in mph and an integer Y which is the speed in mph of the vehicles in a line of traffic.  The time  that it takes for each car to pass the intersection is calculated using the following equation:<n><n>$$ P(n) = (XN) + (YN)^{-1}$$<n><n>Where $n$ is the number of vehicles in the line. For example, let  $X = 3$ mph and $Y = 4$ mph.  If there are 30 vehicles in the line the total time that it would take for the line of vehicles to go from one end of the street intersection to the other is calculated using:<n><n>$$P(30) = (30)(3) + ((4)-1)^{-1} =360(seconds) $$<n><n>## Solution<n><n>Let's say that $B$ is the total number of traffic at intersection, and $X$ be the length and is in number of miles and $Y$, be the speed in number of miles per hour of a car.  So, the equation is<n><n>$$Px \ = \ B$$<n><n>Which means that the number of cars is equal to the amount of time in seconds it takes for the line of cars  to move from one side of the intersection to the other.  If you can multiply these numbers, you will get the answer.  In the first example, we let $B$ be $30$, and divided by $3$, which is equal to $10$ number of vehicles making it equal to the number of hours, that means if you multiply this result

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:Of all the rooms in a house it was his favorite, the aromas always drew him to the what? Choices:  A: yard B: basement C: kitchen D: living room E: garden<n><n>### Response:		 Choice C<n><n>### Input&Output:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answers questions like, “What time is it?”, “Is it wet?”<n><n>1.	Check if the weather is raining or not. If the weather is raining then do not give any result to the user.<n>2.	If the weather is not raining then do the following.<n><n>    1.	Get time of day in 24-hr format “hours with am/pm” from user<n><n>    2.	Check if the time is between 9AM and 5 PM and give response “It is a good time to go out and enjoy your evening. Go for picnic”.<n><n>    3.	Else give the response “It is a bad time. Do not go outside.”<n>    Write your code to complete this task and test your code.<n><n>### Input and Output:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Instructs:<n>Ask the user 5 4 digit numbers and calculate sum of all 5 numbers.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Inputs and Outputs:<n>```<n>1.	Input 5 4 digit values and store in array of size 5.<n>2.	The result will be printed in output.<n>```<n>### Step by Step Explanation<n>1.	Check how much number of objects will be stored in your computer(array).(This will decide the size of your array)<n>2.	Declare an array of size (number of object you have selected).(eg: 5)<n>3.	Store those 5 4 digit number in an array.<n>```<n>//Declare input. In this we are declaring 5 4 digit valus<n>int array[5];<n><n>//Store values in an array<n>for(int i=0; i<5; i++){<n>    cout<<"Enter value: ";<n>    cin>>array[i]; //This means storing numbers from user<n>}<n>```<n>4.	Get the sum of all 5 values.<n> ```<n> //Get the sum of all the values<n> int sum =0;<n> for(int i=0 ; i<5; i++)<n> {<n>     sum += array[i];<n> }<n><n> //Print the value sum<n>cout<<"Sum = "<<sum<< ".";

The checklist is below:<n>```<n>Issue    Test Type   Comments<n>1       Check input         <n>2       Check output     <n>3       Check functionality <n>4       Check if data is      <n>5       Check data in and   <n>6       Check proper response  <n>7       Check logic       <n>```<n>Your boss asks you to write a method that can be used to complete this checklist for all the transactions. The methods can either return boolean or throw exceptions.<n><n>The test method for the new web application is given to you below. It is your job to write the methods that completes each of the tests.<n><n>### Test:<n>```<n>public boolean checkInput(double inValue, char currency, double minAmount, double maxAmount, boolean isNumber, boolean requiredBetween) {<n>    return true;<n>}<n>```<n>### Testing transactions:<n>Below is the transaction and a list of test cases you are asked to test the system with:<n>```<n>Transactions:<n>1. Balance, amount: 125.00<n>2. Balance, amount + 325.00 (500)<n>3. Balance, amount - 500.0         (balance should be zero)<n>4. Balance, amount greater than max<n>5. Balance, amount less than min     <n>6. Transaction number, invalid number.<n>```<n>Your task: Write a Java method that can be used in any of your checks with the given input to complete the tests as given in the tasks.<n>```<n>input:double inValue, char inCurrency, double minAmount,double maxAmount, boolean isInNumber, boolean inBetween<n>```<n>### Outputs:<n>```<n>boolean test1 = checkInput(125,'$2',25,200,true,true)<n>boolean test2 = checkInput(100,'$5',50,200,false,true)<n>false  <n>boolean test3 = checkInput(1500,'$1',-500,2

What is the best explanation for the apparent discrepancy in the customer payment amount and the employee’s checks?  Choices:  A : The employee’s checks were written as a way to avoid being taxed on the received payment.   B: The employee wanted to make sure someone else didn’t claim a gift the employee had received   C: The employee was trying to hide the fact that payment was for other than his work. D: The employer would have had to report a gift to the employee tax collector. E: The $500 checks were gifts to the employee to avoid questions.<n><n>### Response(Multiple choice question) : Answer: D  <n><n>---<n>

Choices:  A: united states B: sky C: court D: field of flowers E: orchard<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: D: field of flowers<n><n>### Output: The correct output<n><n><n>### Explain your response:<n>Bees gather pollen from flowers. They carry the pollen back to their hives where the pollen is used to raise baby bees.<n><n>``` python<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n><n>import math<n>import random<n><n>print ("##############################################")<n>print ("#       Welcome to the Python Quiz #        ")<n>print ("#######################################")<n>print("Welcome, please enter 'Yes' to indicate you agree to the license statement above")<n>print("or 'No' to indicate otherwise")<n>agree = input()<n><n>if agree == "Yes":<n>    print("Thank you for agreeing to the terms of the license statement. What is one of the following:")<n>    print("Python, cats, dogs, pets, animals, reptiles, fish, or shellfish?")<n><n>    pets = input()<n>    print("Thank-you for answering the question. Please answer the following question:")<n>    print ("What is one of the following?")<n>    print("python, cats, dogs")<n>    pets2 = input()<n><n>    if (pets == "python" and pets2 == "cats"):<n>        print("You guessed right!")<n>    elif (pets == "cats" and pets2== "dogs"):<n>        print ("Oh, you got that too right!")<n>    else:<n>        print("wrong")<n>elif agree == "No":<n>    print("That is okay, thanks for taking the time to give it a try.  Bye for now!")<n>```<n><n>``` python<n>answer1 =  ['D', 'B', 'C', 'E', 'A']<n>answer2 = ['A', 'C', 'D', 'B', None]<n><n><n>answer2 = [i for i in answer2 if i is not None][0]<n>if(answer2 == True):<n>    print("yes it is A")<n>elif answer2 == False:<n>    print("No it is not A")<n>```<n><n><n><n>### Exercises:<n><n><n>### How does you solve the
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:John was punching and punching at the wall but succeeded only in bloodying his knuckles. This was bad.  He would be unable to hold his tools if he injured what? Choices:  A: hostility B: anger C: nose D: fists E: hands<n><n>### Response:		Fists<n><n>### Constructive feedback:  Explanation<n><n>A car, when rented, lasts a whole week/week. A car rental charges $30/7= $4.29 per day and if rented for 11 days, then total cost=(4.29*11),<n><n>Since the hurricane threatens Texas, then the duration of driving is 60 miles/an hour =60/60=1.0 mile/minute.<n><n>Then the total time required for transporting her cattle = (1.0mile/minute)*(number of cows)= 1 hour to cover every 10 cows, as the truck holds 2 cows.<n><n>The total transport time required to transport 90 cows = 90*1 min= 90 minutes or<n><n>1.5 hour/s<n><n>The truck can carry 20 head of cows. This can be <n><n>used as substitution.<n><n>The charge to rent the place for 16 days is<n><n>$50+ $50 =$100/16=  $6.25/day.<n><n>Eric has to spend $750/14 = 1/2 hour for transport in a year.<n><n>The ratio of boys to girls is 5:7 for every 180 children so total income for girls = $(5*180) =$900<n><n>And the boys receive =$(7*1800) =$1290, as the girls are twice more i.e.$2*900= $1800. <n><n>The medication part is $(4000*.5) =$2000 and rest are hospital services i.e.$1000 and meals i.e.$150. <n><n>So the ambulance cost =1800 <n><n>### Conclusion<n><n>The task is related to the understanding of units and the basic knowledge of mathematics and simple concepts. It will be helpful whenever the students are faced with these kind of basic mathematical problems in their practical life. <n><n>

Then rewrite the entire sentence.<n><n>- 3.4 million people in the city.(in which/that/whose)<n>- 4.5 billion. (How much has/(Does)/Has)<n>- He's in his late 30s.(Whose/That/in)<n>- The store closes at 8 o'clock. (When/How much/at)<n>- That's a great idea. I will consider that. (In which/Which/Whose)<n>- We are about to open a factory in your city. (Does/Who)<n>We will do this, that and the other. (Is/whichever/which)<n><n>### Instructons:Find the error in each sentence.(In which/on which/In whose/and which)<n><n>> In which do I have to enter all the details?<n><n>> How many has it cost me?<n><n>> This is in which we find many answers.<n><n>> The question in which I'm interested, is this one.<n><n>> That's not the person in which I have to do the deal.<n><n><n>### Instrument:Change the question mark to a period and add the missing word or phrase.<n><n>You are right if you said that this is in which I find all my answers.<n><n>Which?<n><n>### Instrudction:Which of the four answers can you add to the sentence to make it grammatical and meaningful?<n><n>The woman who drove the car in the parking lot, is the woman who will drive the bus to New Jersey.<n><n>The woman who is in charge of driving the bus to New Jersey, is the woman who drove the car the parking lot.<n><n>The woman was driving a car in the parking lote when suddenly, she woke up. <n>She has found her job in which she can work on her own terms.<n><n>When she drove her car to the lot, she got out.  The woman who got out of her car was in charge <n><n><n>

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:If I had a jar which was likely to spoil if left out, where would I want to put it? A 88 feet wide swimming pool<n>2. The length of a 88 feet wide pool is 48 feet<n>3. The width of a swimming pool is 88 feet<n>4. A 10 feet wide swimming pool lengthened by 20 feet and the result is 20 feet longer than the original pool<n>5. A 9 feet wide swimming pool is lengthened by 11 feet and the result is not equal to double the width of the original pool<n><n>## Solution<n><n>-1. How long is the new pool in feet?<n>-2. How many more feet wide is the new pool?<n>-3. How wide is the new pool in inches?<n>-4. How long is the original pool?<n>-5. How wide is the original pool in inches?<n><n><n>### Output<n>1. 56<n>2. 118<n>3. 0.67<n>4. 88<n>5. 16<n>

The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple.  They were dating for a while and wanted to be together for even longer. For this reason, they did what? Choices:  A: make sex B: plan to marry C: dance D: electrical circuit E: row about<n><n>### Response:		John and Jane wanted to have sex, so they made one.  Now with circuitry to power their relationship, the two were always together and never had to talk.  With John acting as the circuit breaker, their relationship never seemed to work, but in the end, nothing bad ever really did happen, since the circuit breaker did its job.<n>

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food. Click on the link and read the instructions on how to answer the question: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Jwc6i-4KkpBP5y6G29YB3WZUOXj71MNxv58Y5Qiq4Y-g/><n><n>2. Click on the first link in the instructions (1. Demonstration), copy the instructions, and paste them into the instructions box on this page.<n><n>### Example<n>Input: The car rental agency charges $40/day for a rental that is less than a week or $30 for rentals that last an entire week.  Jennie rented a vehicle for 5 days. How much, dollar, did her rental cost?<n><n>Demonstration:  I drive an average of 31.6 miles per gallon. Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input :The car-rental agancy charges $30/days for a car, or$190 for the firs week for a rental and that lasts an entire day.How much does it cost to rent the car for three days?<n><n>Output: 380<n><n>### Question:How much does the car cost for five days? <n><n>Output: 450<n><n>### Instructions:How much does it cost tto rent the car for ten days?<n><n>Answer: 890<n><n>### Output:The car cost in total 250 dollars<n> <n>### Instrucion:The car-rental company is charging$30/days for renting a car,or$190 for renting the car for the first week of longer than 7-day. <n>How much does the person pay renting the car for four days, <n>and the car is rented for six days in total?<n><n>Answer: $390<n><n>##  Task:<n><n>### Input  : A poultry farm, Jason, who works on the farm  and  buys all the supplies in town.<n>How much money does Jason get in a year?<n><n>Answer:  15000<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>The man is looking to find out the amount of travel time to and from his destination.<n>The car-rental is charging $30/day or $190 weekly rental if more than 7 days.<n>We will be using addition property, when subtraction isn’t there or too difficult.<n>To add the total number of days, and total cost.<n>15+18= 33 days<n>15 + 190 = $205<n>$205+ 13 (the number of days the truck can hold up to ) = 1525<n>(33 + 13) – 13 = 176

When the user types two and 5, the program should tell the user something nice that they learned based on having more than 2 (but not more than 5) kids.<n><n>    4 married 2 single parents<n><n>The family with the most kids is a single parent who has 9 kids.<n><n>3 married 6 single parents<n>    5 single parent<n>    3 married 1 single parent<n><n>For the family with the most kiddos, the program should say something for the number that is entered, like, “That’s a lot!”<n><n>### Your submission should contain 2 methods and a main method (the do while loop).<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Write the main method and two more methods. Jennie paid 310 for the car rental for rented the car for 11days.<n><n>### Solutions:<n><n>#1. This problem asks for the total bill, so there will be a total of 11days. 1 week is 7 days, plus the first day of the week, so 310 is the total price.<n><n>#2. This problem is asking by what factor it will take the car to travel 60 miles an hour.  100 miles divided by 60 miles an average mileage.  1.7 Miles/Hour/Minutes=100/ 36<n><n>#3. This problem asks for 14 days at 50.00/day or 14 days at total of 500.0. 500/4=125.00. 125.0/(20/20)= 8.5 or how much a day/14 days is $8.50.  8.5/20= 41.75 days.<n><n>#4. This problem asks for total driving in a year. The amount of time is based on the travel time to and from town.<n><n>#5. This problem asks for each boy receives for the amount of money given for the total bill. <n><n>#6. This problem asks for a total of 50% is for medication. 25% of the remaining bill is overnight stays and 175 is for food.  A: $2375 (25% of total $9875), B: 1087 (75% of 1500), C: 1825 (175), D: 725(75% of 987.5). E: 25 (987.5)<n><n><n>### Question Set:<n>This book is very helpful for those who are just starting

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>### Input:A common saying, Sam thought, was to go forth, also this. If you don't have a campsite or the space in your backpack while you're out in nature, choose "B".  Campgrounds typically don't allow you the freedom of having a tent outside the bounds, and they may charge you for it, too (that's called "rent").<n><n>### Input :Who's in charge? Choices: A) mother B) father C) both D) neither<n><n>### Response :If you're the mother or father of the child, choose “A” and “B,” respectively. But, if one or both the parents are out of the child's life, the child doesn't have anyone to look up to on their own.<n><n>### Input  :How fast are you driving? Choice: 40 MPH B) 75 MPH C) 5 MPH D) 80 MPH<n><n>### Response  :If you're driving faster than fifty miles per hour, you're speeding if you get pulled over by the police. If you don't think the police will pull you over for speeding, it's not a crime. But you may wind up injured or have an accident that is not your fault.<n><n>### [Input : When does a rainbow appear? The square in the question's second sentence has the area of 0.64 cubes, which is the area of one cube. These two statements are conflicting, meaning that there is no difference

Choices:  A: europe B: big house C: tuxedo D: palace E: men's room<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer**:<n><n><n>### Demand:Write a test case that passes the above input.<n><n>### Response<n>**Assertion:** <n>- The test case above tests a statement.<n><n>**Test Case:**<n>```bash<n>car_rental_money = 400<n>animal_drive_time = 40<n>house_money = 190<n>carriage_house = 30<n>child_mileage_time = 72<n>boysmoney = 3900<n>Josephine = 1900<n><n>if (car_rental_cost > animal_drive_time * 20 and car_rental_cost * 30 > house_money and carriage_house < house_money and child_mileage_time > 72 and boysmoney > car_rental_mony) {<n>  print(car_rental_value)<n>} else{<n>  print(animal_drive_value)<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>
